The municipality calls itself "Chūō City" in English."Chuo City 2009 Municipal Overview" ; retrieved 2012-3-30. ==History== On March 15, 1947, the ward was formed by combining the wards of Kyōbashi and Nihonbashi. ==Geography== Chūō is in central Tokyo. It borders Tokyo Bay on the south. Minato is on the ward's southwestern border. Chiyoda is on the northwestern border. Sumida and Kōtō are on the east. The most famous districts in Chūō are Ginza and Nihonbashi. Other districtsare Kabutochō and Tsukiji.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Chūō" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 128. In area, Chūō is the second-smallest ward in Tokyo.
